title: How to Make a Ninja Star from Rectangular Paper

steps.headline: Cut the paper along the newly created crease mark.
Fold both papers "hot dog style".
steps.description: Repeat. You should have a smaller and funny rectangle.

steps.headline: Valley fold and unfold each element the other way.
Valley fold the bottom half to the right and upper half to the left at 45 degree angle to create a crease that ends at the middle crease.
Valley fold both rectangular ends in half to create two squares.
Fold those squares in half diagonally bringing corners closer to center of paper and creating two triangles.
Fold those triangles across the center.
steps.description: Crease well and unfold. Repeat with second paper.

steps.headline: Turn both papers over and put one on top of the other.
steps.description: The one on top should be vertical while the paper on the bottom should be horizontal and flat.

steps.headline: Fold the bottom triangle down on the top paper and do the same to the other side of the bottom paper.
steps.description: Do the same to the top paper now but tuck the square from the top into the pocket you just folded up on paper.

text: Take one piece of 8.5"x11" paper.  Fold the paper in half.  Cut the paper along the newly created crease mark.  Fold both papers "hot dog style". Repeat. You should have a smaller and funny rectangle. Valley fold and unfold each element the other way.  Valley fold the bottom half to the right and upper half to the left at 45 degree angle to create a crease that ends at the middle crease. Repeat with second paper. Flip both papers over.  Valley fold both rectangular ends in half to create two squares. Repeat with second paper. Fold those squares in half diagonally bringing corners closer to center of paper and creating two triangles. Repeat with second paper. Fold those triangles across the center. Crease well and unfold. Repeat with second paper. Turn both papers over and put one on top of the other. The one on top should be vertical while the paper on the bottom should be horizontal and flat. Fold the bottom triangle down on the top paper and do the same to the other side of the bottom paper. Do the same to the top paper now but tuck the square from the top into the pocket you just folded up on paper. Finished.
sentences: Take one piece of 8.5"x11" paper.
Fold the paper in half.
Cut the paper along the newly created crease mark.
Fold both papers "hot dog style".
Repeat.
You should have a smaller and funny rectangle.
Valley fold and unfold each element the other way.
Valley fold the bottom half to the right and upper half to the left at 45 degree angle to create a crease that ends at the middle crease.
Repeat with second paper.
Flip both papers over.
Valley fold both rectangular ends in half to create two squares.
Repeat with second paper.
Fold those squares in half diagonally bringing corners closer to center of paper and creating two triangles.
Repeat with second paper.
Fold those triangles across the center.
Crease well and unfold.
Repeat with second paper.
Turn both papers over and put one on top of the other.
The one on top should be vertical while the paper on the bottom should be horizontal and flat.
Fold the bottom triangle down on the top paper and do the same to the other side of the bottom paper.
Do the same to the top paper now but tuck the square from the top into the pocket you just folded up on paper.
Finished.
tyn_section: If you do not have scissors, fold the paper where it needs to be cut, then create a small rip at the top of the crease. After that, just push the two sides of the sheet away from each other
